page.title: 08DURHAM OX INN, SIX HILLS _ 1
page.content:
At the top_most, north_westerly corner of the Ragdale area in North_east Leicestershire lies the area known as Six Hills. This name is a corruption of an older name, Seggs_hill or Segshill, and the real meaning of the place name is the high ground where seggs were kept. Segg was a local name for sheep.
The Durham Ox Inn is a large public house with limited accommodation. It is situated at Six Hills at the intersection of the A46 Trunk Road between Leicester and Newark _ the Roman Fosse Road _ and the B676 Loughborough to Melton Road. The Durham Ox was formerly an old coaching inn.
